info.description:
The RegioJet\'s Affiliate API is a set of endpoints that help your application integrate with RegioJet.

The API is organized arount [REST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer). Our API uses standard HTTP methods, authentication, and status codes.

# Authentication
Authentication to the API is performed via [HTTP Basic Auth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication) for all endpoints listed in this documentation with the exception of `/users/authenticate`, which uses bearer token.

API requests without authentication will fail.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTPS).

# Errors

RegioJet uses conventional HTTP status codes in responses to indicate the success or failure of an API request.

In general:
  * `2xx` codes indicate success;
  * `4xx` codes indicate an error that failed given the information provided in request.
  * `5xx` codes indicate an error with RegioJet's servers.
info.title: RegioJet's Affiliate API Reference

tags.name: Consts
tags.description:
Data that cannot be affected by other endpoints. Contains translations and detailed data about locations, tariffs, etc.

_Note the difference between seat classes, tariffs, and vehicle standards._

parameters.name: X-Application-Origin
parameters.description: Application origin - APP - Mobile application (Android / Apple) - AFF - Affiliate application which is managed by third party - CAT - Web application used to sell catering - DEV - Only for development and testing - DOT - Check-in application for ticket sales on a train or bus - NOT - Unknown application type

parameters.name: X-Lang
parameters.description:
A two-letter language code from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).
Defines the language into which the response will be translated.

Currently supported languages:

| ISO language name | ISO 639-1 code |
|-------------------|----------------|
| Czech             | cs             |
| German            | de             |
| English           | en             |
| Spanish           | es             |
| French            | fr             |
| Hungarian         | hu             |
| Russian           | ru             |
| Slovak            | sk             |
| Ukrainian         | uk             |
| Chinese           | zh             |

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: A flag that indicates whether response should contain only active action prices.

400.description: The request was unacceptable, often due to invalid parameter value or due to missing a required parameter.

401.description: No valid credentials or token provided.

parameters.name: X-Used-DepartureFromDateTime
parameters.description: Should contain `date-time` value from previous route search. Its value is returned in response header of the same name. Used to move forward or backward in search results (i.e. for pagination).

parameters.name: X-Used-DepartureToDateTime
parameters.description: Should contain `date-time` value from previous route search. Its value is returned in response header of the same name. Used to move forward or backward in search results (i.e. for pagination).

parameters.name: fromLocationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for `from` location. This identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint. Unique identifier of either city, or station, can be used.

parameters.name: fromLocationType
parameters.description: Location type of unique identifier used in query parameter `fromLocationId`.

parameters.name: toLocationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for `to` location. This identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint. Unique identifier of either city, or station, can be used.

parameters.name: toLocationType
parameters.description: Location type of unique identifier used in query parameter `toLocationId`.

parameters.name: departureDate
parameters.description: Departure date.

parameters.name: tariffs
parameters.description: List of tariffs. Tariff keys can be obtained from `/consts/tariffs`. Multiple parameter instances should be used rather than multiple values when submitting multiple values. For example: `&tariffs=REGULAR&tariffs=ISIC`

parameters.name: actionPrice
parameters.description: Code indentifier of a marketing action. Filters search result based on applicability of provided marketing action to a route. List of all marketing actions for current route can be obtained from endpoint `/consts/actionPrices`.

parameters.name: move
parameters.description: Move forward or backward in search results. Defines if next call to this endpoint will return next or previous result page.

X-Used-DepartureFromDateTime.description: Departure `from` `date-time` value that was used in current search. This value should be used in header of the same name in the next call to this endpoint. It allows to move forward or backward in search results (i.e. pagination).

X-Used-DepartureToDateTime.description: Departure `to` `date-time` value that was used in current search. This value should be used in header of the same name in the next call to this endpoint. It allows to move forward or backward in search results (i.e. pagination).

400.description: Bad request.

401.description: No valid credentials or token provided.

get.summary: Get details of the given route.
get.description: Returns detailed data for the given route.

parameters.name: routeId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the route. It consists of route section identifiers separed by commas (e.g. `section0.id,section1.id,section2.id`).

parameters.name: fromStationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for `from` station. Detailed data for identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint.

parameters.name: toStationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for `from` station. Detailed data for identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint.

parameters.name: tariffs
parameters.description: List of tariffs. Tariff keys can be obtained from `/consts/tariffs`. Multiple parameter instances should be used rather than multiple values when submitting multiple values. For example: `&tariffs=REGULAR&tariffs=ISIC`

400.description: Bad request.

401.description: No valid credentials or token provided.

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description:
Unique code for the customer's account.

To obtain account code you should go through these two steps:
  1. Create new ticket using endpoint `tickets/create`. This endpoint will return `token` in response, which you should use in the step 2.
  2. Authenticate user's token using endpoint `users/authenticate`, which will return `accountCode` in response.

400.description: The request was unacceptable, often due to invalid parameter value or due to missing a required parameter.

401.description: No valid credentials or token provided.

message.example: Access denied. Please log in first.

url.description: Publicly available URL of an action.

showIcon.description: Flag that indicates wheter icon should be shown with action price name.

text.example: There's security members walking through train during travel

BannerBubble.description: Bubble picture with possibility of redirection to more informations

amount.description: Amount of money in chosen currency taken from ticket/addon/... which will not be refunded.

percent.description: Number of percents of original price that will be withheld for cancel.

CancelCharge.description: Amount of money charged for reservation cancel.

controlHash.description: Hash (MD5) of cancellation terms, agreed on by the customer

refundToOriginalSource.description: TRUE if refund money after ticket cancel should return to original source, otherwise FALSE

stationsTypes.description: Types of stations available in a city.

discount.description: Flat rate discount sum in ticket currency

codeDiscount.description: Flat rate discount from fare price (does not apply on addons and charges). Applies first (before percentual discount)

percentualDiscountIds.description: Percentual discount from fare price (does not apply on addons and charges). Applies as seconds (after flat rate discount)

CreateTicketRequest.description: TODO: passenger by ml mt pznak isInsuarence + data...

token.description: Newly created user account token which is linked to ticket(s)

priceSource.description: Pricing ID - used for confirmation that price, services or conditions werent changed

affiliateCode.description: Optional code of an affiliate partner.

CustomerActions.description: Defines which actions can be executed with current ticket state

value.example: The language you entered is not allowed, these are available [cs, sk, en, de, at, hu, es, fr, ru, uk, zh, pl]

email.description: Email are always required after first passenger if not pre-filled in user account (or customer isnt logged in)

amount.description: Basic price (ticket purchase) for tariff set on ticket with ticket currency (doesnt count with discounts)

moneyBack.description: Final amount for passenger which will be refunded if canceled.

priceSource.description: Pricing ID - used for confirmation that price, services or conditions werent changed

otherPassengersData.description: Required fields for all other passengers

firstPassengerData.description: Required fields for 1st passenger (returns only if tickets is editable)

otherPassengersData.description: Required fields for all others passengers (returns only if tickets is editable)

changeCharge.description: Administrative charge for user information change (in ticket currency)

PassengersInfo.description: Summary of all informations needed for work with passengers.

services.description: Service icons for wifi, steward, etc.

priceSource.description: Pricing ID - used for price, services or terms confirmation after route search.

example: Connection is operated by partner carrier company MT-Lines

bookable.description: `true` if there are free seats in class available for reservation, otherwise `false`.

code.description: Control MD5 hash transformed from conditions content (used for current terms visibility check).

refundToOriginalSourcePossible.description: States that if its possible to refund money to original money source

cancelCharge.description: Sum of all cancel charges in chosen currency.

cancel.example: more than 15 minutes before departure: 0 %, less than 15 minutes: not possible

rebook.example: more than 15 minutes before departure: by cancellation for 0 CZK, less than 15 minutes: not possible

ticketId.description: If there is used discount there is as well ticket ID which is linked to it.

id.description: Unique identifier of a route. Consists of unique sections identifiers separated by commas.

mainSectionId.description: Main section of the route. Only for this section can customer select seat class or vehicle standard.

freeSeatsCount.description: Number of available free seats through all sections.

notices.description: Notice of any extraordinarily events on route / traffic limitation

bookable.description: TRUE if at least one class have enough free seats for reservation, otherwise FALSE

delay.description: Textual information about the first delay on the route

travelTime.description: Textual information about the travel time on the route

id.description: Unique identifier of a route. Consists of unique sections identifiers separated by commas.

mainSectionId.description: Main section of the route. Only for this section can customer select seat class or vehicle standard.

freeSeatsCount.description: Number of available free seats through all sections.

notices.description: Notice of any extraordinarily events on route / traffic limitation

bookable.description: TRUE if at least one class have enough free seats for reservation, otherwise FALSE

delay.description: Textual information about the first delay on the route

travelTime.description: Textual information about the travel time on the route

fixedSeatReservation.description: TRUE => seat reservation; FALSE => seat choosed while boarding
TRUE => seat reservation; FALSE => seat choosed while boarding

seatConstraint.example: Only women are allowed to this coupe
seatConstraint.description: Notification which needs to be confirmed by customer before continue in reservation

example: You've choosed seat in LOW COST class - without service. Seats are equipped with elbow armrest and are unmovable, thats why they're suitable for short distance traveling. Bottled water Rajec, newspapers and magazines are available. Enjoy undisturbed travel with option of watching more than 50 movies, listening music and playing games in your own device.
seatNotes.description: Supplementary informations which are shown but isnt required to be confirmed

key.description: Seat class key. Used in responses of other endpoints.

description.example: Coupe for groups of 2-6 persons, disinfection for passengers. Free Illy coffee, free Rajec water. Possibility to order additional refreshments from the on-board menu at the best prices.

imageUrl.description: URL of a seat class thumbnail image.

galleryUrl.description: URL of a publicly accessible complete information about a seat class.

support.description: `true` if it is a support connnection or `false` if this is a RegioJet connection.

supportCode.description: Codes of individuals support connections on a single route.

fixedSeatReservation.description: `true` if seat can be chosen during reservation or `false` if seat is chosen during boarding.

arrivalPlatform.example:
* `BUS` - 3
* `BUS` - S2
* `BUS` - Streat title (used exceptionally, for example at lockout or detour)
* `VLAK` - 2/1
* `VLAK` - -/1
* `VLAK` - 1/-
* `VLAK` - -/-

notices.description: Extraordinary event on route / traffic limitation

items.example: There are fatal accident on line, delay will be 120 minutes

delay.description: Textual information about the delay on a given section

travelTime.description: Textual information about the travel time on a given section

conditionsHash.description: Hash (MD5) of cancellation terms, agreed on by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier of a route. Consists of unique sections identifiers separated by commas.

freeSeatsCount.description: Number of available free seats through all sections.

priceFrom.description: Minimum ticket price for open account.

priceTo.description: Maximum ticket price for open account.

creditPriceFrom.description: Minimum ticket price for RegioJet Pay.

creditPriceTo.description: Maximum ticket price for RegioJet Pay.

actionPrice.description: `true` if any price is action price, otherwise `false`.

surcharge.description: `true` if there is surcharge on this route, otherwise `false`.

notices.description: Notice of any extraordinary events on route or traffic problems.

support.description: `true` if this route (or its part) have support (e.g. in form of additional railroad cars), otherwise `false`.

nationalTrip.description: `true` if route is interstate, `false` if route is international.

bookable.description: `true` if at least one class have enough free seats for reservation, otherwise `false`.

delay.description: Textual information about the first delay on the route.

travelTime.description: Textual information about route's travel time.

vehicleStandardKey.description: Vehicle standard key. Detailed data about every available vehicle standard can be obtained from `/consts/vehicleStandards`.

routesMessage.example: Connection between these destinations dont exist. Edit your search parameters and try again
routesMessage.description: Message describing exceptionally behavior or route search states

routesMessage.example: In accordance with state of emergency declared by the Czech Government and by the governments of other EU countries, all international routes are canceled. Routes between these destinations in the selected dates are not available. Thank you for your understanding.
routesMessage.description: Message describing exceptional state of route search.

fromStationId.description: Valid station ID (city ID unsupported at this level)

toStationId.description: Valid station ID (city ID unsupported at this level)

address.example: eleznin stanice Hlavn ndra, Ndran 418/7, 602 00 Brno-sted

stationTimeZoneCode.description: [TZ database](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) time zone name in which station is located.

wheelChairPlatform.description:
"Name of wheelchair platform provider (if available)."

Possible providers:

  | Provider name | Provider code |
  |---------------|---------------|
  | esk drhy   | CD            |
  | RegioJet      | RJ            |

significance.description: Station's significance within the city. (e.g. for the city of Brno, Brno main railway station is more significant than Brno - Krlovo Pole railway station.)

longitude.description: The geographic longitude where station is located.

latitude.description: The geographic latitude where station is located.

price.description: Surcharge amount (is not included in basic route price or even in `priceClass`).

notification.example: Every reservation on this route will be in addition charged with non refundable surcharge of 300 CZK.
notification.description: Notification which needs to be confirmed by customer.

key.description: Tariff's key that is used in responses from other endpoints.

title.example: Following tariffs do not have discounts

description.example: These tariffs were changed to tariffs corresponding with reserved route. Price remained unchanged

text.example: There's security members walking through train during travel

price.description: Final price for ticket, addons etc.

items.example: Line is servised by partner carrier bus MT-Lines

paymentId.description: Payment ID (groupTransactionID). Available only with paid ticket. Necessary for further action with ticket (for example: print invoice)

surcharge.description: Total count of all irreversible surcharges in current currency

cancelChargeSum.description: Total count of all charges and surcharge

delay.description: Textual information about the first delay on the route

travelTime.description: Textual information about the travel time on a given section

Ticket.description: expirationDate is date-time value states when ticket expires. ExpiresAt states how many days, hours and minutes left to ticket expiration.

fixedSeatReservation.description: TRUE => seat reservation; FALSE => seat choosed while boarding

TicketState.description:
* `USED` - driven ticket
* `VALID` - Valid and paid ticket
* `UNPAID` - Unpaid reservation
* `CANCELED` - Canceled by user (soft-booking)
* `DELETED` - Canceled by user (hard-booking)
* `EXPIRED` - Expirated soft-booking which cant be bought anymore
* `TO_BE_EXPIRED` - Expirated soft-booking which werent be able to finish by system

fromStationId.description: Station ID from which customer needs to transfer

toStationId.description: Station ID to which customer needs to transfer

description.example: Bus station can be found right opossite train station. Station is marked with sign Autobusov stanica. Go after yellow RegioJet buses which leaves from platform number 21.

Transfer.description: Informations about individual transfers (transfer order coincides with individual section order => 1st transfer is between 1st and 2nd section...). calculatedTransferTime is calculated tranfer time in minutes (departure time - arrival time), determinedTransferTime is used time in minutes needed for transfer.

TransferType.description:
* `NONE` - Transfer between platforms within one station
* `WALKING` - Transfer by walk
* `PUBLIC_TRANSPORT` - Public transportation transfer

info.example: Connections planned as follow-up in event of delay there can happen re-reservation to follow-up connection or refund money for unused part of route

accountCode.description: Used as account ID for login

restrictPhoneNumbers.description: Restrict phone number for work with sms.

creditPrice.description: Difference between registered credit account with price advantage and regular unregistered open account

defaultTariffKey.description: Set tariff which would be pre-filled after login

conditionsAcceptance.description: Acceptance of transport conditions and personal data protection

employeeNumber.description: NULL for normal customer, internal number for Regiojet employee

code.description: Vehicle code tag (BUS => SPZ, VAGON => code)

example: You've chosen seat on line where you wont be accompanied by steward(ess). Bus driver will ensure check-in, safe and nothing disturbed travel. Connection will be operated by air-conditioned bus with toilet and services like wifi, newspapers or fun portal (depend on bus type).
notifications.description: Additional informations relating to whole vehicle. These informations are visible, but wont requiring confirmation.

code.description: Vehicle code tag (BUS => SPZ, VAGON => code)

example: You've chosen seat on line where you wont be accompanied by steward(ess). Bus driver will ensure check-in, safe and nothing disturbed travel. Connection will be operated by air-conditioned bus with toilet and services like wifi, newspapers or fun portal (depend on bus type).
notifications.description: Additional informations relating to whole vehicle. These informations are visible, but wont requiring confirmation.

cateringEnabled.description: Indicates if catering is enabled in current vehicle (i.e. it is possible for a customer to place catering order).

key.description: Vehicle standard key that will be used in responses from other endpoints.

description.example: Open space or compartment air-conditioned coaches, Wi-Fi internet for free, 230 V electric sockets.

imageUrl.description: URL to vehicle standard thumbnail image.

supportImageUrl.description: URL to support vehicle thumbnail image.

galleryUrl.description: URL to publicly available information about vehicle standard.

id.description: Comma-separated list of route section identifiers.

connectionCode.description: Connection code, as recognized by an external entity (e.g. OneTicket), not bound to any format.

departureStationId.description: Numeric and unique representation of the departure station.

departureTime.description: Departure time in the ISO 8601 format.

arrivalStationId.description: Numeric and unique representation of the arrival station.

arrivalTime.description: Arrival time in the ISO 8601 format.

priceFrom.description: Price of the least expensive route.

priceTo.description: Price of the most expensive route.

notices.description: Are there any traffic limitations or extraordinary events on the route?

support.description: Does this line have a support connection?

delay.description: Information about the first delay on the route in the 'HH:MM \h' format.

price.description: Final price for ticket, addons etc.

delay.description: Textual information about the first delay on the route.

travelTime.description: Textual information about the travel time on a given section.

affiliateTicket.description: Was the ticket created by an affiliate partner?

departureCancel.description: Departure Cancel Time for sro ticket

cancellationFee.description: Cancellation Fee price for sro ticket, addons etc.

accountCode.description: Ticket number that customer need during checkin on board.

sroTickets.description: Information about the newly created ticket.

key.description: Name of parameter, where error occured.

message.example: It is not possible to search connections so far to future
Bus/train could not be found. Please search again.

example.value: Tariff name is incorrect. Please search for the bus/train again.
You have to agree with the terms.

xApplicationOrigin.name: X-Application-Origin
xApplicationOrigin.description: Application origin - APP - Mobile application (Android / Apple) - AFF - Affiliate application which is managed by third party - CAT - Web application used to sell catering - DEV - Only for development and testing - DOT - Check-in application for ticket sales on a train or bus - NOT - Unknown application type

xLang.name: X-Lang
xLang.description:
A two-letter language code from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).
Defines the language into which the response will be translated.

Currently supported languages:

| ISO language name | ISO 639-1 code |
|-------------------|----------------|
| Czech             | cs             |
| German            | de             |
| English           | en             |
| Spanish           | es             |
| French            | fr             |
| Hungarian         | hu             |
| Russian           | ru             |
| Slovak            | sk             |
| Ukrainian         | uk             |
| Chinese           | zh             |

xCurrency.name: X-Currency
xCurrency.description:
A three-letter currency code from [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).
Defines monetary unit to be used in respons.

Currently supported currencies:

| Currency     | ISO 4217 code |
|--------------|---------------|
| Czech koruna | CZK           |
| Euro         | EUR           |

xTxToken.name: X-TxToken
xTxToken.description: Internal ID of the operation - used for check status 204.

accountCode.name: accountCode
accountCode.description:
Unique code for the customer's account.

To obtain account code you should go through these two steps:
  1. Create new ticket using endpoint `tickets/create`. This endpoint will return `token` in response, which you should use in the step 2.
  2. Authenticate user's token using endpoint `users/authenticate`, which will return `accountCode` in response.

tariffs.name: tariffs
tariffs.description: List of tariffs. Tariff keys can be obtained from `/consts/tariffs`. Multiple parameter instances should be used rather than multiple values when submitting multiple values. For example: `&tariffs=REGULAR&tariffs=ISIC`

routeId.name: routeId
routeId.description: Unique identifier for the route. It consists of route section identifiers separed by commas (e.g. `section0.id,section1.id,section2.id`).

fromStation.name: fromStationId
fromStation.description: Unique identifier for `from` station. Detailed data for identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint.

toStation.name: toStationId
toStation.description: Unique identifier for `from` station. Detailed data for identifier can be obtained from `/consts/locations` endpoint.

departureDate.name: departureDate
departureDate.description: Date and time of departure. Date is required. Time is optional.

201.description: One or more new resources have been successfully created.

400.description: The request was unacceptable, often due to invalid parameter value or due to missing a required parameter.

401.description: No valid credentials or token provided.
